section.name: A container for CLI
section.p: Avalon Castle is a lightweight container for the CLI (.Net and Mono) world. Although it can be viewed as a port of Avalon, it benefits from several features offered by the CLR.

Other important difference of Castle container is its simplicity. Based on Microkernel pattern, the user can easily modify, extend or adapt it to match his requirements. No hard contracts, no obligations. Just good and old Inversion of Control and stills Avalon.

section.name: Microkernel
section.p: The Microkernel pattern allowed us to focus on a simple set of classes which constitutes the environment for managed components.

section.name: DynamicProxy
section.p: To overcome some limitations of CLR we had to develop some other tools used by Avalon Castle. DynamicProxy is a simple implementation that immitates the Java proxies through Invocation handlers.

section.name: ManagedExtensions
section.p: If one needs a more powerfull container, allowing him to managed his components through some remote interface, he can use the managed extensions. In fact the ManagedExtensions can be viewed as a port of JMX for CLI.
